basics.name: Lorin Zahra-Newman
basics.label: Digital Weisenheimer
basics.tl;dr: Passionate about IT, business and scuba. Strong sys admin skills and seeking to expand my knowledge into the development world.
basics.summary:
About:
Passionate about all things tech & scuba with a diverse skill set ranging from systems administration to small business management, film production, group training and leadership. I am seeking a shift from the small business world into an environment that will allow me to further develop my programming and IT skill set.  

Living on the forefront of IT in Australia, over the last 30 years I have witnessed my parents launch their time management software Smart Alarms into space on the 91 Atlantis Shuttle mission, the proliferation of networks and the rise and fall of the dotcom boom & health information systems beyond.  

Over the past two years I've been teaching myself program, and shifting from the MS ecosystem and into the opensource linux/BSD world. I am comfortable in most basic front and back end languages and the explosion of tooling that's occurred for both web development and systems administration. 

Proficient in bash scripting and both Debian flavor'd distributions, FreeBSD, and more recently Arch Linux. Comfortable with config and use of Ansible, Vagrant, Docker, Nginx, SSH, LetsEncrypt/OpenSSL, PHP/SQL server configs & basic query/scripting, basic use of NodeJS, NPM, Bower. 

Currently learning the idiosyncrasies of Javascript before moving onto some of the task runners and frameworks out in the wild.

work.summary:
Whilst working as a dive instructor, I also started consulting LEI on their current IT systems and provided technical support and maintenance to their infrastructure as required. I contracted these services out through my company Aquanaut Expeditions.

Duties involved:
•	Advised on new backup procedures to be implemented, including offsite backups 
•	Checked and maintained backup system in place
•	Installed additional node on network, managed infrastructure and liaised with ISP’s
•	Advised on specifications for new or replacement hardware 
•	Repaired computers and migrated data as required
•	Supported POS system; liaising with POS vendor’s technical support
•	Configure workstation user profiles, applications, printers and email for new staff
•	Cleaned operating systems and preformed virus scans on workstations as required
•	General application support and staff training as required

Though an amazing job and great passion of mine, the simplicity of this role left me unchallenged and I found myself asserting my other various skills within the company.

Duties involved:
•	Guiding dive groups of up to 8 customers at a time
•	Teaching dive courses
•	Leading and presenting boat tours
•	Servicing equipment and tank valves
•	Daily customer service and interaction with guests
•	Providing informative and accurate information to guests about sea states and conditions 
•	Providing first aid to guests as required
•	Providing assistance in the rescue and resuscitation of guests as required
•	Selling stocked cameras, dive gear & inventory
•	Promoting off-peak periods to guests and creating return customers
•	Organising daily boat manifests & planning next day’s schedule
•	End of day reporting procedures and tallying of monies 
•	Monthly stock-take
•	Opening and closing shop
•	General cleaning and keeping the shop tidy

Starting a media production company was a great (and expensive) learning experience in a difficult but exciting industry. I enjoyed working on several film productions and developed a robust system for managing the business/productions operations.

Duties involved: 
•	Created, shot & edited short film – A Series of Precarious Predicaments
•	Produced short film for client – Eviction
•	Collaborated on feature film – Convict
•	Negotiated Nepalese co-production Super Gorkhe 
	Secured rights
	Recorded title song
	Shot music video
•	Developed product line for actor showreels
	Created promo video/ad
•	Designed and implemented a cloud based management system, by customizing and integrating several online SAAS & cloud tools, to allow for the tracking and delegation of production workflows, documents, contracts, financials, etc.

work.company: Aquanaut Expeditions | Journey Beneath the Liquid Horizon.
work.summary: Training and leading scuba divers safely underwater for the last four years.

Bank Reconciliation
Accounts Payable/Receivable
EOY/EOM Procedures
Preparation of financial reports

My family founded JAM in 1984, developing time & practice management software for healthcare practitioners; a small family business that still continues on today. 
Surrounded by professionals, I grew up on the forefront of technology in Australia, working and learning from the various minor facets of the company, 
As a young adult I spent almost 10 years working through the various areas of the company starting as the reception/bookkeeper and working right through to general management. 

Duties involved: 
•	Software design and development
•	General management
•	Office administration & accounts
•	Sales rep and marketer
•	Installation and systems trainer
•	Customer service technician

My time at JAM taught me a lot in IT & small business but also showed me that I needed to move forward and find my own path.

One of my first real jobs out of school and during my accounting diploma. I helped manage 400 units’ accounts and after working with auditors for 18months, I decided to return to the family business and manage JAM’s accounts and admin.

Duties involved:
•	Processing of expense invoices into strata system
•	Generating and sending of monthly levies
•	Collating and filing of paperwork
•	Liaising with auditors and providing assistance as required
•	Customer service; answering phone/greeting customers
•	Assisting strata managers as required
•	Collecting money and banking
